title-group.article-title: The Effect of Forced Conversions on Common Stock Prices

abstract.p: The focus of this study is on the effect of forced conversion of either convertible debentures or convertible preferred stock on common stock prices. Using residual analysis on a sample of 161 forced conversions occurring between 1963 and 1975, it was found that forced conversions follow strong upward price movements and precede strong downward price movements. This observed pattern of price behavior around the announcement date was found to be unaffected by either the percentage of the convertible issue outstanding at the call date or APB Opinion 15.
